   "source": [
    "\n",
    "# Tweaking the (non-) linear solvers\n",
    "Here we look at how to tweak the internal linear and nonlinear solvers.\n",
    "The `solve` method on the `schemes` uses a Newton method to solve\n",
    "the (non)linear PDE model. Parameters set during the construction of a `scheme`\n",
    "can be used to customize the Newton solver and the underlying solver for\n",
    "the linear problem in each step, i.e., setting line-search parameters or\n",
    "preconditioners. A number of linear solvers and some simple\n",
    "preconditioners are directly available and others can be used through\n",
    "additional software packages. This is done by changing the\n",
    "linear algebra backend (e.g. using `petsc`) by using the\n",
    "`storage` parameter during construction of the discrete space.\n",
    "The simplicity of the default backend (`numpy`) allows to extract the\n",
    "underlying data structures to use with Numpy/Scipy on the python side.\n",
    "A degrees of freedom vector (dof vector) can be retrieved as `numpy.array`\n",
    "from a discrete function with this default storage by using the `as_numpy`\n",
    "attribute on an instance of a discrete function. Similar attributes are available\n",
    "for the other storages, i.e., `as_istl,as_petsc`. The same attributes are\n",
    "also available to retrieve the underlying matrix structures on linear\n",
    "operators/schemes.\n",
    "A short description on the other storages with examples using the internal\n",
    "bindings for these packages follows at the end of this section.\n",
    "We will discuss how to use these attributes to implement (parts of)\n",
    "the solution algorithm on the Python side using `Scipy` or `PETSc4py`\n",
    "[will follow](solversExternal_nb.ipynb).\n",
    "\n",
    "We will mostly revisit the nonlinear problem studied at the end of the\n",
    "section on [non-linear elliptic problems](dune-fempy_nb.ipynb#A-non-linear-elliptic-problem)\n",
    "in the introduction - using a prescribed forcing to obtain the exact solution\n",
    "\\begin{align*}\n",
    "u(x,y) = \\left(\\frac{1}{2}(x^2 + y^2) - \\frac{1}{3}(x^3 - y^3)\\right) + 1\n",
    "\\end{align*}\n",
    "The following code was described in the [introduction](dune-fempy_nb.ipynb)"
   ]
  },
  {
   "cell_type": "code",
   "execution_count": 1,
   "id": "8041486c",
   "metadata": {
    "execution": {
     "iopub.execute_input": "2025-11-29T23:11:47.604484Z",
     "iopub.status.busy": "2025-11-29T23:11:47.604212Z",
     "iopub.status.idle": "2025-11-29T23:11:49.471314Z",
     "shell.execute_reply": "2025-11-29T23:11:49.470268Z"
    },
    "lines_to_next_cell": 1
   },
   "outputs": [],
   "source": [
    "import numpy\n",
    "\n",
    "from dune.grid import structuredGrid as leafGridView\n",
    "from dune.fem.space import lagrange\n",
    "from dune.fem import integrate\n",
    "from ufl import TestFunction, TrialFunction, SpatialCoordinate, FacetNormal, \\\n",
    "                dx, ds, div, grad, dot, inner, exp, sin, conditional\n",
    "\n",
    "gridView = leafGridView([0, 0], [1, 1], [24, 24])\n",
    "space = lagrange(gridView, order=2, storage='istl')\n",
    "u_h = space.interpolate(0, name='u_h')\n",
    "\n",
    "x,u,v,n = ( SpatialCoordinate(space), TrialFunction(space), TestFunction(space), FacetNormal(space) )\n",
    "exact = 1/2*(x[0]**2+x[1]**2) - 1/3*(x[0]**3 - x[1]**3) + 1\n",
    "\n",
    "a  = ( inner(grad(u),grad(v)) + (1+u)**2*u*v ) * dx\n",
    "bf = (-div(grad(exact)) + (1+exact)**2*exact) * v * dx\n",
    "bg = dot(grad(exact),n)*v*ds\n",
    "\n",
    "# simple function to show the result of a simulation\n",
    "def printResult(method,error,info):\n",
    "    print(method,\"L^2, H^1 error:\",'{:0.5e}, {:0.5e}'.format(\n",
    "                 *[ numpy.sqrt(e) for e in integrate([error**2,inner(grad(error),grad(error))]) ]),\n",
    "          \"\\n\\t\",\"solver info=\",info,flush=True)"
   ]
  },
  {
   "cell_type": "markdown",
   "id": "2cc84e29",
   "metadata": {},
   "source": [
    "When creating a scheme, it is possible to set the linear solver as well as\n",
    "parameters for the internal Newton solver and the linear solver (e.g. for\n",
    "preconditioning). See a list of available solvers and preconditioning\n",
    "methods at [the end of this section](#Available-solvers-and-parameters).\n",
    "The default solver is a `gmres`\n",
    "method but since this problem is symmetric a `cg` solver is more\n",
    "efficient. In addition we will use a Jacobi preconditioner and set\n",
    "the tolerance for the Newton method to $10^{-8}$. In addition we also\n",
    "use the `Eisenstat-Walker` strategy for choosing the tolerance for the\n",
    "linear solver - this requires the error measure to be `residual\n",
    "reduction`."
   ]
  },
  {
   "cell_type": "code",
   "execution_count": 2,
   "id": "1c348ee5",
   "metadata": {
    "execution": {
     "iopub.execute_input": "2025-11-29T23:11:49.473368Z",
     "iopub.status.busy": "2025-11-29T23:11:49.473093Z",
     "iopub.status.idle": "2025-11-29T23:11:49.560231Z",
     "shell.execute_reply": "2025-11-29T23:11:49.559294Z"
    }
   },
   "outputs": [],
   "source": [
    "from dune.fem.scheme import galerkin\n",
    "scheme = galerkin(a == bf+bg, solver='cg',\n",
    "                  parameters={\"linear.preconditioning.method\":\"jacobi\",\n",
    "                              \"nonlinear.forcing\":\"eisenstatwalker\",\n",
    "                              # this is the default for this forcing\n",
    "                              \"linear.errormeasure\":\"residualreduction\",\n",
    "                              \"nonlinear.tolerance\":1e-7},\n",
    "                 )"
   ]
  },
  {
   "cell_type": "markdown",
   "id": "0d39ce37",
   "metadata": {},
   "source": [
    ".. tip:: we use Krylov methods like `cg` and `gmres` in this section to\n",
    "   solve the linear problems. We also provide bindings for direct solvers\n",
    "   from the `suitesparse` package, e.g., `umfpack` if installed. For this use\n",
    "   `solver=[\"suitesparse\",\"umfpack\"]` when constructing the scheme.\n",
    "\n",
    "We can simply use the `galerkin` scheme instance to compute the solution\n",
    "as shown previously in [the introduction section](dune-fempy_nb.ipynb)."
   ]
  },
  {
   "cell_type": "code",
   "execution_count": 3,

   "source": [
    "u_h.interpolate(2)               # start with the boundary conditions at the top\n",
    "info = scheme.solve(target=u_h)\n",
    "printResult(\"Default\",u_h-exact,info)\n",
    "u_h.plot()"
   ]
  },
  {
   "cell_type": "markdown",
   "id": "4301cd72",
   "metadata": {},
   "source": [
    "\n",
    "## Python sided Newton solver\n",
    "We can also only use the internal linear solvers and write the Newton\n",
    "method in Python - here is a very simple version of that.\n",
    "The central new method is `linear` available on the scheme that returns a\n",
    "linear `scheme` which represents the Jacobian of the model around a given grid function `ubar`.\n",
    "Much more details on the methods used are given\n",
    "[in the next section](solversExternal_nb.ipynb)."
   ]
  },
  {
   "cell_type": "code",
   "execution_count": 4,
   "id": "4942fa61",
   "metadata": {
    "execution": {
     "iopub.execute_input": "2025-11-29T23:12:21.648654Z",
     "iopub.status.busy": "2025-11-29T23:12:21.648445Z",
     "iopub.status.idle": "2025-11-29T23:12:53.806615Z",
     "shell.execute_reply": "2025-11-29T23:12:53.805363Z"
    }
   },
   "outputs": [
    {
     "name": "stdout",
     "output_type": "stream",
     "text": [
      "Newton 1 L^2, H^1 error: 1.17597e-06, 1.83002e-04 \n",
      "\t solver info= {'iterations': 4, 'linear_iterations': 618}\n"
     ]
    }
   ],
   "source": [
    "class Scheme1:\n",
    "    def __init__(self, scheme, u0):\n",
    "        self.scheme = scheme\n",
    "        self.jacobian = scheme.linear(ubar=u0) # obtain a linear operator for the Newton method\n",
    "\n",
    "    def solve(self, target):\n",
    "        # create a copy of target for the residual\n",
    "        res = target.copy(name=\"residual\")\n",
    "        dh  = target.copy(name=\"direction\")\n",
    "        n, linIter = 0,0\n",
    "        while True:\n",
    "            # res = S[u]\n",
    "            #     = u - g on boundary\n",
    "            self.scheme(target, res)\n",
    "            absF = res.scalarProductDofs(res)\n",
    "            if absF < 1e-7**2: # this is the same tolerance we set above for the built-in Newton solver\n",
    "                break\n",
    "            self.scheme.jacobian(target,self.jacobian)  # assemble the linearization\n",
    "            # dh = DS[u]^{-1}S[u]\n",
    "            #    = u - g on boundary\n",
    "            dh.clear()\n",
    "            info = self.jacobian.solve(target=dh,rightHandSide=res)\n",
    "            linIter += info[\"linear_iterations\"]\n",
    "            # unew = u - DS[u]^{-1}S[u]\n",
    "            #      = u - (u-g) = g on boundary\n",
    "            target -= dh\n",
    "            n += 1\n",
    "        return {\"iterations\":n, \"linear_iterations\":linIter}\n",
    "\n",
    "u_h.interpolate(2)                        # start with the boundary conditions at the top\n",
    "scheme_cls = Scheme1(scheme,u0=u_h)\n",
    "info = scheme_cls.solve(target=u_h)\n",
    "printResult(\"Newton 1\",u_h-exact,info)"
   ]
  },
  {
   "cell_type": "markdown",
   "id": "39063179",
   "metadata": {},
   "source": [
    ".. tip:: The iterative linear solvers use the provided target discrete\n",
    "   function as initial guess for the iteration - so here we are starting\n",
    "   with `0` in each step of the Newton method."
   ]
  },
  {
   "cell_type": "markdown",
   "id": "00447fb9",
   "metadata": {},
   "source": [
    "A second version using a linearization of the non-linear problem\n",
    "including an affine shift, i.e., the first two terms in the Taylor\n",
    "expansion around a given $\\bar{u}$:\n",
    "$$ L[u] = DS[\\bar{u}](u-\\bar{u}) + S[\\bar{u}] $$"
   ]
  },

   "cell_type": "code",

     "iopub.status.idle": "2025-11-29T23:12:54.310704Z",
     "shell.execute_reply": "2025-11-29T23:12:54.309559Z"
    }
   },
   "outputs": [
    {
     "name": "stdout",
     "output_type": "stream",
     "text": [
      "0 141085.74926120762\n",
      "1 17905.920241774333\n",
      "2 7537.485122978748\n",
      "3 2816.7394179534726\n",
      "4 729.4500739362206\n",
      "5 67.95220111350947\n",
      "6 0.5837200125700535\n",
      "7 4.0818883975234545e-05\n",
      "8 0.0\n"
     ]
    },
    {
     "name": "stdout",
     "output_type": "stream",
     "text": [
      "Newton 2 (gmres) L^2, H^1 error: 1.17597e-06, 1.83002e-04 \n",
      "\t solver info= {'iterations': 8, 'linear_iterations': 2201}\n"
     ]
    }
   ],
   "source": [
    "from dune.fem.scheme import linearized\n",
    "class Scheme2:\n",
    "    def __init__(self, scheme, u0):\n",
    "        self.scheme = scheme\n",
    "        # let's use a `gmres` solver for demonstration purposes\n",
    "        self.linear = linearized(scheme, ubar=u0,\n",
    "                      parameters={ \"method\":\"gmres\", \"gmres.restart\":50,\n",
    "                               # the scheme uses Eisenstat-Walker forcing\n",
    "                               # with 'residual reduction' as error measure\n",
    "                               # without the forcing 'absolute' is the default error measure\n",
    "                               \"errormeasure\":\"absolute\",\n",
    "                            })\n",
    "\n",
    "    def solve(self, target):\n",
    "        prev = target.copy()\n",
    "        n, linIter = 0,0\n",
    "        # we are not computing the residual directly so need a different\n",
    "        # stopping criteria, i.e., size of the step dh\n",
    "        while True:\n",
    "            # setup L[u] = DS[u^n](u-u^n) + S[u^n]\n",
    "            # Then L[u] = 0 leads to\n",
    "            # u = (DS[u^n])^{-1} (DS[u^n]u^n-S[u^n])\n",
    "            #   = u^n - DS[u^n])^{-1}S[u^n]\n",
    "            #   = u^{n+1}\n",
    "            self.linear.setup(target)\n",
    "            info = self.linear.solve(target=target)\n",
    "            linIter += info[\"linear_iterations\"]\n",
    "\n",
    "            # We don't have access to the residual so we use |u^{n+1}-u^n|\n",
    "            # as stopping criteria.\n",
    "            # Subtract the new iterate from the previous one\n",
    "            prev.sub( target )\n",
    "            absDiff = prev.scalarProductDofs(prev)\n",
    "            print(n,absDiff)\n",
    "            if absDiff < 1e-7**2:\n",
    "                break\n",
    "            prev.assign(target)\n",
    "            n += 1\n",
    "        return {\"iterations\":n, \"linear_iterations\":linIter}\n",
    "\n",
    "u_h.clear()                         # reset u_h - so we start the Newton method with u_h=0\n",
    "scheme_cls = Scheme2(scheme,u_h)\n",
    "info = scheme_cls.solve(target=u_h)\n",
    "printResult(\"Newton 2 (gmres)\",u_h-exact,info)"
   ]
  },

    ".. tip:: the parameters used to tweak the linear solver set when constructing\n",
    "   the `scheme` are passed on to the linear solver when calling\n",
    "   `scheme.linear` but can be overwritten.\n",
    "   Below we construct a linearization (by default around zero) which uses a `gmres`\n",
    "   method when calling `jac.solve` - the same would work with\n",
    "   `sc.linear(parameter={..})`.\n",
    "\n",
    "Here is another example of this:"
   ]
  },

   "cell_type": "code",

     "shell.execute_reply": "2025-11-29T23:13:26.523100Z"
    }
   },
   "outputs": [
    {
     "name": "stdout",
     "output_type": "stream",
     "text": [
      "{'converged': True, 'iterations': 0, 'linear_iterations': 1106, 'timing': []}\n"
     ]
    }
   ],
   "source": [
    "model = ( inner(grad(u), grad(v)) + (u - conditional(dot(x,x)<0.6,10.,0.))*v ) * dx\n",
    "# verbose output for the linear solver is too long so use default `False` setting\n",
    "sc  = galerkin(model==0, solver=\"cg\",\n",
    "               parameters={\"linear.verbose\":False,\"nonlinear.verbose\":True}\n",
    "              )\n",
    "sol = space.interpolate(0, name=\"u_h\")\n",
    "jac = linearized(sc, parameters={ \"method\":\"gmres\", \"gmres.restart\":100, })\n",
    "info = jac.solve(target=sol)\n",
    "print(info,flush=True)"
   ]
  },

   "metadata": {},

    ".. index::\n",
    "   triple: Solvers; Dirichlet; Conditions\n",
    "\n",
    ".. index::\n",
    "   pair: Boundary; Linear Solvers\n",
    "\n",
    "## Handling Dirichlet boundary conditions\n",
    "We first look at a simple Poisson problem with Dirichlet BCs\n",
    "to show how to use the internal solvers in this setting.\n",
    "We solve $-\\triangle u=15\\chi_\\omega$ where $\\chi_\\omega$ is a characteristic\n",
    "function with $\\omega=\\{x\\colon |x|^2<0.6\\}$. For the boundary\n",
    "we prescribe trivial Neumann at the top and bottom boundaries\n",
    "and Dirichlet values $u=-1$ and $u=1$ at the left and right\n",
    "boundaries, respectively."
   ]
  },
  {
   "cell_type": "code",
   "execution_count": 8,
   "id": "b76aba37",
   "metadata": {
    "execution": {
     "iopub.execute_input": "2025-11-29T23:13:26.544963Z",
     "iopub.status.busy": "2025-11-29T23:13:26.544762Z",
     "iopub.status.idle": "2025-11-29T23:13:58.793453Z",
     "shell.execute_reply": "2025-11-29T23:13:58.792877Z"
    }
   },
   "outputs": [],
   "source": [
    "from dune.ufl import DirichletBC\n",
    "model = ( inner(grad(u), grad(v)) - 15*conditional(dot(x,x)<0.6,1.,0.) * v ) * dx\n",
    "dbcs  = [ DirichletBC(space,-1,1), DirichletBC(space, 1,2) ]\n",
    "op  = galerkin([model==0, *dbcs], space)\n",
    "sol = space.interpolate(0, name=\"u_h\")\n",
    "lin = op.linear()"
   ]
  },
  {
   "cell_type": "markdown",
   "id": "7f7ff559",
   "metadata": {},
   "source": [
    "So far everything is as before. Dirichlet boundary conditions\n",
    "are handled in the matrix through changing all rows\n",
    "associated with boundary degrees of freedom to unit rows -\n",
    "associated columns are not changed so the matrix will not be symmetric anymore.\n",
    "For solving the system we need to modify the right hand side\n",
    "and the initial guess for the iterative solver to include\n",
    "the boundary values (to counter the missing symmetry).\n",
    "We can use the first of the three versions of the\n",
    "`setConstraints` methods on the scheme class discussed in the section on\n",
    "[more general boundary conditions](boundary_nb.ipynb#Accessing-the-Dirichlet-degrees-of-freedom)."
   ]
  },
  {
   "cell_type": "code",
   "execution_count": 9,
   "id": "9d75b8c7",
   "metadata": {
    "execution": {
     "iopub.execute_input": "2025-11-29T23:13:58.796270Z",
     "iopub.status.busy": "2025-11-29T23:13:58.796056Z",
     "iopub.status.idle": "2025-11-29T23:13:59.019479Z",
     "shell.execute_reply": "2025-11-29T23:13:59.018656Z"
    }
   },
   "outputs": [
    {
     "data": {
      "image/jpeg": "",
      "text/plain": [
       "<Figure size 320x240 with 2 Axes>"
      ]
     },
     "metadata": {},
     "output_type": "display_data"
    }
   ],
   "source": [
    "op.setConstraints(sol)\n",
    "\n",
    "# setup the right hand side\n",
    "rhs = sol.copy()\n",
    "op(sol,rhs)\n",
    "rhs *= -1\n",
    "op.setConstraints(rhs)\n",
    "lin.solve(rightHandSide=rhs,target=sol)\n",
    "sol.plot()"
   ]
  },

   "source": [
    "Let's revisit our two implementations of the Newton method discussed\n",
    "above but with Dirichlet conditions on the whole boundary:"
   ]
  },
  {
   "cell_type": "code",
   "execution_count": 10,
   "id": "6259fa43",
   "metadata": {
    "execution": {
     "iopub.execute_input": "2025-11-29T23:13:59.021635Z",
     "iopub.status.busy": "2025-11-29T23:13:59.021419Z",
     "iopub.status.idle": "2025-11-29T23:13:59.100486Z",

   "source": [
    "scheme = galerkin([a == bf, DirichletBC(space,exact)], solver='cg')"

  {
   "cell_type": "markdown",
   "id": "e6ad7d68",
   "metadata": {},
   "source": [
    "## Other internal solvers (petsc)\n",
    ".. index::\n",
    "   pair: Solvers; Petsc\n",
    "\n",
    "The following requires that a PETSc installation was found during the\n",
    "configuration of ``dune``."
   ]
  },
  {
   "cell_type": "code",
   "execution_count": 13,
   "id": "f393968d",
   "metadata": {
    "execution": {
     "iopub.execute_input": "2025-11-29T23:15:03.428191Z",
     "iopub.status.busy": "2025-11-29T23:15:03.427985Z",
     "iopub.status.idle": "2025-11-29T23:15:03.434613Z",
     "shell.execute_reply": "2025-11-29T23:15:03.433778Z"
    }
   },
   "outputs": [],
   "source": [
    "from dune.common.checkconfiguration import assertCMakeHave, ConfigurationError\n",
    "try:\n",
    "    assertCMakeHave(\"HAVE_PETSC\")\n",
    "    petsc = True\n",
    "except ConfigurationError:\n",
    "    print(\"Dune not configured with petsc - skipping example\")\n",
    "    petsc = False"
   ]
  },
  {
   "cell_type": "markdown",
   "id": "7bfe27b1",
   "metadata": {},
   "source": [
    "We provide internal bindings to parts of the PETSc package and show this\n",
    "first. How to make use of `petsc4py` is shown\n",
    "[in a later section](solversExternal_nb.ipynb).\n",
    "\n",
    "Switching to a storage based on the PETSc solver package and solving the\n",
    "system using the dune-fem bindings can be achieved by using the\n",
    "``storage`` argument to the space constructor.\n",
    "\n",
    ".. note:: We can use the\n",
    "   ufl forms we already have defined. Normally the space\n",
    "   to use is extracted from the form but this can\n",
    "   be overwritten by providing a `space` argument\n",
    "   during scheme construction.\n",
    "\n",
    "We'll use Dirichlet BCs at the left boundary only:"
   ]
  },
  {
   "cell_type": "code",
   "execution_count": 14,
   "id": "1eec0618",
   "metadata": {
    "execution": {
     "iopub.execute_input": "2025-11-29T23:15:03.436208Z",
     "iopub.status.busy": "2025-11-29T23:15:03.436041Z",
     "iopub.status.idle": "2025-11-29T23:15:35.673761Z",
     "shell.execute_reply": "2025-11-29T23:15:35.672623Z"
    }
   },
   "outputs": [
    {
     "name": "stdout",
     "output_type": "stream",
     "text": [
      "PETSc L^2, H^1 error: 1.17613e-06, 1.83002e-04 \n",
      "\t solver info= {'converged': True, 'iterations': 4, 'linear_iterations': 22, 'timing': [0.052214518, 0.02601463, 0.026199888]}\n"
     ]
    }
   ],
   "source": [
    "if petsc:\n",
    "    spacePetsc = lagrange(gridView, order=2, storage='petsc')\n",
    "    # We use an sor preconditioner:\n",
    "    schemePetsc = galerkin([a == bf+bg, DirichletBC(space,exact,2)],\n",
    "                           space=spacePetsc, solver=\"cg\",\n",
    "                           parameters={\"linear.preconditioning.method\":\"hypre\"})\n",
    "    uPetsc_h = spacePetsc.interpolate(2, name='u_h')\n",
    "    info = schemePetsc.solve(target=uPetsc_h)\n",
    "    printResult(\"PETSc\",uPetsc_h-exact,info)"
   ]
  },
  {
   "cell_type": "markdown",
   "id": "dc571199",
   "metadata": {},
   "source": [
    "## Other internal solvers (istl)\n",
    ".. index::\n",
    "   pair: Solvers; dune-istl\n",
    "\n",
    "We can just as easily use the `dune-istl` package to solve the system\n",
    "(`dune-istl` should be available when installing `dune-fem`).\n",
    "\n",
    ".. tip:: instead of changing the storage in the space requiring some\n",
    "   extra compilation it is also possible to provide the solver\n",
    "   information directly to the scheme as shown here."
   ]
  },
  {
   "cell_type": "code",
   "execution_count": 15,
   "id": "9b5d5505",
   "metadata": {
    "execution": {
     "iopub.execute_input": "2025-11-29T23:15:35.676656Z",
     "iopub.status.busy": "2025-11-29T23:15:35.676343Z",
     "iopub.status.idle": "2025-11-29T23:16:08.133670Z",
     "shell.execute_reply": "2025-11-29T23:16:08.132445Z"
    }
   },
   "outputs": [
    {
     "name": "stdout",
     "output_type": "stream",
     "text": [
      "Dune-Istl L^2, H^1 error: 1.17597e-06, 1.83002e-04 \n",
      "\t solver info= {'converged': True, 'iterations': 4, 'linear_iterations': 42, 'timing': [0.305807792, 0.026154272, 0.27965352000000004]}\n"
     ]
    }
   ],
   "source": [
    "spaceIstl = lagrange(gridView, order=2, storage='istl')\n",
    "# We use an amg preconditioner:\n",
    "schemeIstl = galerkin(a == bf+bg, solver=(\"istl\",\"cg\"),\n",
    "                      parameters={\"linear.preconditioning.method\":\"amg-jacobi\"})\n",
    "u_h.interpolate(2)\n",
    "info = schemeIstl.solve(target=u_h)\n",
    "printResult(\"Dune-Istl\",u_h-exact,info)"
   ]
  },
  {
   "cell_type": "markdown",
   "id": "c075df11",
   "metadata": {},
   "source": [
    ".. index::\n",
    "   triple: I/O; Logging; Parameters\n",
    "\n",
    "## Parameters for fine-tuning the internal solvers\n",
    "Sometimes it is necessary to extract which parameters were read and which\n",
    "values were used, e.g., for debugging purposes like finding spelling\n",
    "in the parameters provided to a scheme.\n",
    "Note that this information can only be reliably obtained after usage of\n",
    "the scheme, e.g., after calling solve as shown in the example below.\n",
    "To add logging to a set of parameters passed to a `scheme` one simply\n",
    "needs to add a `logging` key to the parameter dictionary provided to the scheme\n",
    "with a tag (string) that is used in the output.\n",
    "\n",
    "As an example we will solve the simple Laplace equation from the\n",
    "introduction but pass some preconditioning parameters to the scheme."
   ]
  },
  {
   "cell_type": "code",
   "execution_count": 16,
   "id": "12536ad2",
   "metadata": {
    "execution": {
     "iopub.execute_input": "2025-11-29T23:16:08.136436Z",
     "iopub.status.busy": "2025-11-29T23:16:08.136223Z",
     "iopub.status.idle": "2025-11-29T23:16:40.222080Z",
     "shell.execute_reply": "2025-11-29T23:16:40.221593Z"
    }
   },
   "outputs": [
    {
     "name": "stdout",
     "output_type": "stream",
     "text": [
      "Fem::CG preconditioning=jacobi\n",
      "Fem::CG it: 0 : residual 3.14787e-13\n",
      "Fem::CG it: 1 : residual 1.08053e-13\n"
     ]
    }
   ],
   "source": [
    "import dune.fem\n",
    "from dune.grid import structuredGrid\n",
    "from dune.fem.space import lagrange\n",
    "from ufl import (TestFunction, TrialFunction, SpatialCoordinate,\n",
    "                 dx, grad, inner, dot, sin, cos, pi )\n",
    "gridView = structuredGrid([0, 0], [1, 1], [200, 200])\n",
    "space = lagrange(gridView, order=1)\n",
    "u_h   = space.interpolate(0, name='u_h')\n",
    "x = SpatialCoordinate(space)\n",
    "u = TrialFunction(space)\n",
    "v = TestFunction(space)\n",
    "\n",
    "f = (8*pi**2+1) * cos(2*pi*x[0])*cos(2*pi*x[1])\n",
    "a = ( inner(grad(u),grad(v)) + u*v ) * dx\n",
    "l = f*v * dx\n",
    "scheme = galerkin( a==l, solver=\"cg\", parameters=\n",
    "                   {\"linear.tolerance\": 1e-12,\n",
    "                    \"linear.verbose\": True,\n",
    "                    \"linear.preconditioning.method\": \"jacobi\",\n",
    "                    \"linear.errormeasure\": \"relative\",\n",
    "                    \"logging\": \"log-jacobi\"\n",
    "                   } )\n",
    "info = scheme.solve(target=u_h)"
   ]
  },
  {
   "cell_type": "markdown",
   "id": "55f09121",
   "metadata": {},
   "source": [
    "We use the `pprint` (pretty print) module if available to get nicer\n",
    "output."

      " 'log-jacobi': {('fem.solver.linear.maxiterations', '2147483647'),\n",

      "                ('fem.solver.nonlinear.linesearch', 'none'),\n",
      "                ('fem.solver.nonlinear.maxiterations', '2147483647'),\n",

      "                ('fem.solver.nonlinear.simplified', 'false'),\n",
      "                ('fem.solver.nonlinear.tolerance', '1e-06'),\n",
      "                ('fem.solver.nonlinear.verbose', 'false'),\n",
      "                ('linear.errormeasure', 'relative'),\n",
      "                ('linear.method', 'cg'),\n",
      "                ('linear.preconditioning.method', 'jacobi'),\n",
      "                ('linear.tolerance', '1e-12'),\n",
      "                ('linear.verbose', 'True')}}\n"
     ]
    }
   ],
   "source": [
    "try:\n",
    "    from pprint import pprint as _pprint\n",
    "    pprint = lambda *args,**kwargs: _pprint(*args,**kwargs,width=200,compact=False)\n",
    "except ImportError:\n",
    "    pprint = print\n",
    "\n",
    "pprint(dune.fem.parameter.log())"
   ]
  },
  {
   "cell_type": "markdown",
   "id": "a00ad58e",
   "metadata": {},
   "source": [
    "Note above that all parameters are printed including some default ones\n",

    "To access only the parameters used in the scheme simply use\n",

  {
   "cell_type": "markdown",
   "id": "fe705c5b",
   "metadata": {},
   "source": [
    "One can easily reuse these parameters to construct another scheme by\n",
    "converting the result of the above call to a dictionary.\n",
    "As an example change the above problem to a PDE with Dirichlet conditions\n",
    "but turn off verbose output of the solver.\n",
    "\n",
    ".. note:: The `logging` parameter has to be set if we want to use the\n",
    "`parameterLog` method on the scheme."
   ]
  },
  {
   "cell_type": "code",

   ],
   "source": [
    "param = dict(scheme.parameterLog()) # this method returns a set of pairs which we can convert to a dictionary\n",
    "param[\"logging\"] = \"Dirichlet\" # only needed to use the `parameterLog` method\n",
    "param[\"linear.verbose\"] = False\n",
    "scheme2 = galerkin( [a==l,DirichletBC(space,0)], parameters=param )\n",
    "u_h.interpolate(2)\n",
    "info = scheme2.solve(target=u_h)\n",
    "pprint(scheme2.parameterLog())"
   ]
  },
  {
   "cell_type": "markdown",
   "id": "c2d638aa",
   "metadata": {},
   "source": [
    ".. tip:: To get information about available values for some parameters\n",
    "(those with string arguments) a possible approach is to provide a non valid\n",
    "string, e.g., `\"help\"`."
   ]
  },
  {
   "cell_type": "code",
   "execution_count": 20,
   "id": "a3fcdc60",
   "metadata": {
    "execution": {
     "iopub.execute_input": "2025-11-29T23:17:12.418125Z",
     "iopub.status.busy": "2025-11-29T23:17:12.417921Z",
     "iopub.status.idle": "2025-11-29T23:17:12.464489Z",
     "shell.execute_reply": "2025-11-29T23:17:12.463600Z"
    }
   },

  {
   "cell_type": "markdown",
   "id": "5a5bb2df",
   "metadata": {},
   "source": [
    ".. index::\n",
    "   triple: Solvers; Available solvers; Parameters\n",
    "\n",
    "## Available solvers and parameters\n",
    "Upon creation of a discrete function space one also have to specifies the\n",
    "storage which is tied to the solver backend.\n",
    "As mentioned, different linear algebra backends can be accessed by changing setting the\n",
    "`storage` parameter during construction of the discrete space. All\n",
    "discrete functions and operators/schemes based on this space will then\n",
    "use this backend. Available backends are `numpy,istl,petsc`.\n",
    "Note that not all methods which are available in `dune-istl` or `PETSc` have been forwarded\n",
    "to be used with `dune-fem`."
   ]
  },
  {
   "cell_type": "code",
   "execution_count": 21,
   "id": "444021da",
   "metadata": {
    "execution": {
     "iopub.execute_input": "2025-11-29T23:17:12.466382Z",
     "iopub.status.busy": "2025-11-29T23:17:12.466203Z",
     "iopub.status.idle": "2025-11-29T23:17:12.469794Z",
     "shell.execute_reply": "2025-11-29T23:17:12.469020Z"
    }
   },
   "outputs": [],
   "source": [
    "space = lagrange(gridView, order=2)"
   ]
  },
  {
   "cell_type": "markdown",
   "id": "ee5f9573",
   "metadata": {},
   "source": [
    "Switching is as simple as passing `storage='istl'` or  `storage='petsc'`.\n",
    "Here is a summary of the available backends\n",
    "\n",
    "| Solver    | Description |\n",
    "| --------- | ------------------------------------------------------------------- |\n",
    "| numpy     | the storage is based on a raw C pointer which can be                |\n",
    "|           | directly accessed as a numpy.array using the Python buffer protocol |\n",
    "|           | To change the underlying vector of a discrete function `u_h` use    |\n",
    "|           | `uh.as_numpy[:]`.                                                   |\n",
    "|           | As shown in the examples, linear operators return a                 |\n",
    "|           | `scipy.sparse.csr_matrix` through the `as_numpy` property.          |\n",
    "| istl      | data is stored in a block vector/matrix from the dune.istl package  |\n",
    "|           | Access through `as_istl`                                            |\n",
    "| petsc     | data is stored in a petsc vector/matrix which can also be used with |\n",
    "|           | petsc4py on the python side using `as_petsc`.                        |"
   ]
  },
  {
   "cell_type": "markdown",
   "id": "885facb2",
   "metadata": {},
   "source": [
    ".. index:: Solvers; Parameters\n",
    "\n",
    "When creating a scheme, there is the possibility to select a linear\n",
    "solver for the internal Newton method.\n",
    "In addition the behavior of the solver can be customized through a\n",
    "parameter dictionary. This allows to set tolerances, verbosity, but also\n",
    "which preconditioner to use.\n",
    "\n",
    "For details see the help available for a scheme:"
   ]
  },
  {
   "cell_type": "code",
   "execution_count": 22,
   "id": "81dcb17f",
   "metadata": {
    "execution": {
     "iopub.execute_input": "2025-11-29T23:17:12.471746Z",
     "iopub.status.busy": "2025-11-29T23:17:12.471571Z",
     "iopub.status.idle": "2025-11-29T23:17:12.477298Z",

    }

    {
     "name": "stdout",
     "output_type": "stream",
     "text": [
      "Help on Scheme in module dune.generated.femscheme_1830e0b499d58f20cb34ce353560f035 object:\n",
      "\n",
      "class Scheme(pybind11_builtins.pybind11_object)\n",
      " |  A scheme finds a solution `u=ufl.TrialFunction` for a given variational equation.\n",
      " |  The main method is `solve` which takes a discrete functions as `target` argument to\n",
      " |  store the solution. The method always uses a Newton method to solve the problem.\n",
      " |  The linear solver used in each iteration of the Newton method can be chosen\n",
      " |  using the `solver` parameter in the constructor of the scheme. Available solvers are:\n",
      " |  ------------------------------------------\n",
      " |  |  Solver  |         Storage             |\n",
      " |  |   name   |  numpy  |  istl   |  petsc  |\n",
      " |  |----------|---------|---------|---------|\n",
      " |  | bicg     |   ---   |   ---   |    x    |\n",
      " |  | bicgstab |    x    |    x    |    x    |\n",
      " |  | cg       |    x    |    x    |    x    |\n",
      " |  | gmres    |    x    |    x    |    x    |\n",
      " |  | gradient |   ---   |    x    |   ---   |\n",
      " |  | loop     |   ---   |    x    |   ---   |\n",
      " |  | minres   |   ---   |    x    |    x    |\n",
      " |  | preonly  |   ---   |   ---   |    x    |\n",
      " |  | superlu  |   ---   |    x    |   ---   |\n",
      " |  ------------------------------------------\n",
      " |\n",
      " |  In addition the direct solvers from the `suitesparse` package can be used with the\n",
      " |  `numpy` storage. In this case provide a tuple as `solver` argument with \"suitesparse\" as\n",
      " |  first argument and the solver to use as second, e.g.,\n",
      " |  'solver=(\"suitesparse\",\"umfpack\")'.\n",
      " |\n",
      " |  The detailed behavior of the schemes can be customized by providing a\n",
      " |  `parameters` dictionary to the scheme constructor, e.g.,\n",
      " |     {\"nonlinear.tolerance\": 1e-3,       # tolerance for newton solver\n",
      " |      \"nonlinear.verbose\": False,        # toggle iteration output\n",
      " |      \"nonlinear.maxiterations\": maxInt, # max number of nonlinear iterations\n",
      " |      \"nonlinear.linesearch\": True,      # use a simple bisection line search\n",
      " |      \"nonlinear.forcing\": \"none\",       # can switch to eisenstatwalker\n",
      " |      \"nonlinear.simplified\": False,     # use a quasi Newton method with single Jacobian evaluation\n",
      " |\n",
      " |      \"linear.tolerance\": 1e-5,          # tolerance for linear solver\n",
      " |      \"linear.verbose\": False,           # toggle linear iteration output\n",
      " |      \"linear.maxiterations\":1000,       # max number of linear iterations\n",
      " |      \"linear.errormeasure\": \"absolute\", # or \"relative\" or \"residualreduction\"\n",
      " |\n",
      " |      \"linear.preconditioning.method\": \"jacobi\",          # (see table below)\n",
      " |      \"linear.preconditioning.hypre.method\": \"boomeramg\", #  \"pilu-t\" \"parasails\"\n",
      " |      \"linear.preconditioning.iteration\": 3,              # iterations for preconditioner\n",
      " |      \"linear.preconditioning.relaxation\": 1.0,           # omega for SOR and ILU\n",
      " |      \"linear.preconditioning.level\": 0}                  # fill-in level for ILU preconditioning\n",
      " |  -----------------------------------------------\n",
      " |  |  Precondition | (x = parallel | s = serial) |\n",
      " |  |  method       |  numpy  |   istl  |  petsc  |\n",
      " |  |---------------|---------|---------|---------|\n",
      " |  | amg-ilu       |   ---   |    x    |   ---   |\n",
      " |  | amg-jacobi    |   ---   |    x    |   ---   |\n",
      " |  | gauss-seidel  |    x    |    x    |    x    |\n",
      " |  | hypre         |   ---   |   ---   |    x    |\n",
      " |  | icc           |   ---   |   ---   |    x    |\n",
      " |  | ildl          |   ---   |    x    |   ---   |\n",
      " |  | ilu           |   ---   |    s    |    s    |\n",
      " |  | jacobi        |    x    |    x    |    x    |\n",
      " |  | kspoptions    |   ---   |   ---   |    x    |\n",
      " |  | lu            |   ---   |   ---   |    s    |\n",
      " |  | ml            |   ---   |   ---   |    x    |\n",
      " |  | none          |    x    |    x    |    x    |\n",
      " |  | oas           |   ---   |   ---   |    x    |\n",
      " |  | pcgamg        |   ---   |   ---   |    x    |\n",
      " |  | sor           |    x    |    x    |    x    |\n",
      " |  | ssor          |    x    |    x    |    x    |\n",
      " |  -----------------------------------------------\n",
      " |\n",
      " |  The functionality of some of the preconditioners listed for petsc will\n",
      " |  depend on the petsc installation.\n",
